column1: as per Section 72 and Schedule III of the Land Development Ordinance, the
4th Respondent has no legal right to be appointed as the successor since he is
not the biological son or the eldest son of the initial permit holder, said K.A.
Andrew.  The  Petitioner  further  states  that  the  Divisional  Secretary  has
arbitrarily acted and has accordingly granted the title to the impugned land
to  the  4th  Respondent,  neglecting  the  legitimate  succession  rights  of  the
Development (Amendment) Act No.16 of 1969 and No.27 of 1981 stipulates
the entitlement of the spouse of the deceased permit holder to succeed to
the land alienated to such permit holder on a permit. The said Section 48A of
the Land Development Ordinance is as follows;
